item.description:
Let's go see Bob Marley!  No, not that one, but I think you'll like this one.  Bob Marley, the comedian from Maine, will be performing at the Rochester Opera House,  http://www.rochesteroperahouse.com/ ,for one day only--Friday, October 14 at 8 pm.  Let's do dinner first in Rochester.  Any restaurant suggestions??

Tickets can be ordered online at this site:  http://sa1.seatadvisor.com/sabo/servlets/TicketRequest?eventId=471846&presenter=ROH&venue=&event. Tickets are $27.50 per person.  I have already purchased 5 tickets in total for myself and friends who plan to attend (Orchestra, Row F, contiguous Seat #'s 2,4,6,8,10). 

As of October 2nd, the show is almost sold out.  If you want to attend, contact the Rochester Opera House ASAP!

For those interested, we'll meet for dinner at 6 pm at the Lilac City Grille.  It's at 45 North Main Street (the old Slim's Tex Mex building).  Here's a link to the restaurant's Facebook page:  https://www.facebook.com/pages/Lilac-city-grille/142298299179200?sk=wall#!/pages/Lilac-city-grille/142298299179200.   Try to be there BY 6 pm so we can order early then relax and enjoy each other's company before heading over to the Rochester Opera House.  At 7:30 we'll leave for the ROH which is at 31 Wakefield Street inside City Hall.  It's a beautifully restored venue that we've enjoyed before.  If you can't make it for dinner, please plan to meet us in the lobby of City Hall at 7:40.  The ROH requests that we all be in our seats by 7:50, late seating is up to their discretion.

Here's a little bit about Bob Marley:

Crack-Up with Bob!   Strap yourself in for a hilarious ride with Bob Marley, one of the hottest stand-up comedians in the country, for an evening of side splitting laughter. The Maine native is a headliner at Caesar’s Palace and the Trump Plaza in Las Vegas and is one of the few comics to appear on all the late night shows with hosts David Letterman, Jay Leno and Conan O’Brian. Marley’s source of material, delivered with an exaggerated New England accent, comes from everyday events in the lives of his family and friends. His father often asks, “Is this going to be in one of your skits?” Variety Magazine named Bob Marley one of the “10 Comics to Watch”.  Marley has also appeared in several films and is remembered for his role as Detective Greenly in the cult favorite Boondock Saints.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at Restaurant by 6 or ROH lobby by 7:40

group.name: Trailblazers- A Seacoast Singles Meetup Group

item.name: Comedian Bob Marley at Rochester Opera House & Dinner at Lilac City Grille
